content: Write a sonnet about friendship in the style of Jane Austen.

In Austen's grace, I pen this sonnet fine,
On friendship's bond, so dear and true to time.
With wit and charm, her words doth entwine,
A tapestry of hearts, a sweet chime.

Like Elizabeth and Jane, their spirits bright,
Through trials tested, stood firm and steady.
Their laughter shared, in moments of delight,
A comfort found, in each other's company.

So too, like Darcy and Bingley, so true,
Their loyalty, a testament of grace.
Through life's pursuits, their friendship grew,
A bond unbroken, in love's sweet space.

Thus, in Austen's style, I sing of friends,
Whose love endures, through life's many bends.
